overview: From 2026-01-18 to 2026-01-25, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (2 merged), 2 new issues, and 14 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Add agent discovery module to landing page and dashboard (Last)
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
Public agents will be listed here. 

Sorting by newest/oldest, popular (we should bring back that chat count like character.ai), featured (allows us to manually showcase certain agents). Search by username?

topIssues.title: Fix TOCTOU race condition in credit deduction for streaming endpoints
topIssues.author: linear
topIssues.body:
Implement "deduct-before, reconcile-after" pattern to fix TOCTOU (Time-Of-Check-To-Time-Of-Use) race condition in streaming API endpoints.

Clean unification (we already do a good TOCTOU in MCP!
```markdown BEFORE (Vulnerable - Race Condition) â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• Request 1 â”€â”€â” Request 2 â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â–¶ CHECK balance â‰¥ $0.02? â”€â”€â–¶ âœ… YES â”€â”€â” Request 3 â”€â”€â”¤ (all pass) â”‚ Request N â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â–¼ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ STREAMING (10+ sec) â”‚ â”‚ No lock held on balance â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â–¼ All requests â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â–¶ DEDUCT $0.02 each â”‚ â–¼ ğŸ’¥ Balance goes NEGATIVE or deductions FAIL silently AFTER (Fixed - Atomic Reservation) â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• Request 1 â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” Request 2 â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â–¶ â”‚ ATOMIC: SELECT FOR UPDATE + DEDUCT â”‚ Request 3 â”€â”€â”¤ â”‚ (PostgreSQL row lock on org balance) â”‚ Request N â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â–¼ â–¼ â–¼ Request 1 Request 2-N âœ… RESERVED âŒ 402 REJECTED $0.03 (with buffer) "Insufficient credits" â”‚ â–¼ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ STREAMING (10+ sec) â”‚ â”‚ Credits already deducted â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â–¼ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ RECONCILE: actual cost = $0.012 â”‚ â”‚ REFUND: $0.03 - $0.012 = $0.018 â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â–¼ âœ… Balance NEVER negative ```

topIssues.title: SQL error 384-dim zero vector fallback
topIssues.author: Xayaan
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

USE_OPENAI_EMBEDDING setting isn't being respected, and the code is using a 384-dim zero vector fallback while the DB adapter is hardcoded to use the dim_1536 column.

Error      [PLUGIN:SQL] Failed to create entities (entityId=a2271fc6-fcbd-03f5-afa6-9e462c212936, error=Failed query: insert into "entities" ("id", "agent_id", "created_at", "names", "metadata") values ($1, $2, default, $3, $4) on conflict do nothing


**To Reproduce**


**Expected behavior**


**Screenshots**


**Additional context**

Full error : 

Error engaging with search terms: 36 |   async queryWithCache(queryString, params, query) {
37 |     if (this.cache === void 0 || is(this.cache, NoopCache) || this.queryMetadata === void 0) {
38 |       try {
39 |         return await query();
40 |       } catch (e) {
41 |         throw new DrizzleQueryError(queryString, params, e);
                   ^

topIssues.title: Dashboard bug
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
Clicking out of the box here should take user back to original window when clicking on create again

topPRs.title: fix(v2.0.0): Python example testing & fixes
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
- Add Python quickstart documentation (docs/python-quickstart.md) - Fix chat example to include inmemorydb plugin for database support - Add dotenv loading to chat example for .env file support - Fix inmemorydb plugin to use proper Plugin class instead of dict - Fix inmemorydb adapter to accept params dict in get_memories() - Fix inmemorydb adapter to handle Pydantic models in create_memory/update_memory - Fix character provider to use getattr for optional attributes - Add get_available_actions() method to AgentRuntime - Add get_entity() alias method to AgentRuntime - Update get_memories() to accept keyword arguments The Python port had issues because: Plugin export - was a dict instead of Plugin object Method signatures - expected dicts but got Pydantic models No type enforcement - Python doesn't catch these at compile time The Rust type system prevents these bugs automatically. The Python fixes we made bring it to parity with the working Rust implementation. # Risks Medium # Background ## What does this PR do? Fix examples/chat/python ## What kind of change is this? Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work? Review # Documentation changes needed? maybe --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces true streaming and stabilizes Python runtime/plugins, plus major example and training additions. > > - Adds streaming text APIs: new `ModelType.TEXT_*_STREAM`, `AgentRuntime.use_model_stream()`/`register_streaming_model()`, and `DefaultMessageService.handle_message_stream()` with `StreamingMessageResult` > - OpenAI plugin implements streaming handlers; core exports updated to include streaming types > - Fixes `plugin-inmemorydb`: converted to proper `Plugin`, adapter now accepts `params`/kwargs, handles Pydantic models (camelCase keys), and corrects pagination/filters > - Hardens character provider to safely access optional fields via `getattr` > - AgentRuntime enhancements: `get_available_actions()`, `get_entity()` alias, `get_memories()` kwargs support > - A2A FastAPI server uses true token-by-token SSE streaming and includes `inmemorydb`; requirements updated > - Chat example loads `.env` and includes `inmemorydb` plugin > - ART Ticâ€‘Tacâ€‘Toe: adds heuristic agent, refines config (`opponent`, `ai_player`), winner/draw handling, and CLI updates > - New Atropos TextWorld package: environment/agents, trajectory + tokenizer tooling, offline data generation, BaseEnv factory, and CLI; README expanded > - Core Python README and example docs updated for setup and usage > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 21f8c31fc22b7778f998d85c754ee82a0a8e2253. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary This PR fixes the Python chat example and inmemorydb plugin to work together, adds Python quickstart documentation, and improves Character attribute handling. The changes include: **Key Improvements:** - Adds comprehensive Python quickstart documentation with examples - Fixes inmemorydb plugin to use proper Plugin class instead of dict - Enhances inmemorydb adapter to handle Pydantic models in create_memory/update_memory - Updates character provider to safely access optional attributes with getattr() - Adds dotenv support to chat example for .env file loading - Adds useful helper methods to AgentRuntime (get_available_actions, get_entity alias) - Enhances get_memories() to accept keyword arguments **Critical Issues Found:** 1. **Bug in adapter.py line 329**: The update_memory() method references the wrong variable name (`memory` instead of `memory_dict`), which will cause AttributeError when processing Pydantic models 2. **Bug in character.py lines 70-73**: Inconsistent attribute access - uses getattr() in function body but direct access in return data dict, causing AttributeError for optional attributes 3. **Missing dependency in chat.py**: Imports python-dotenv but it's not in requirements.txt 4. **Incomplete documentation**: Quickstart guide doesn't include inmemorydb plugin installation that the chat example now requires **Impact:** The bugs in adapter.py and character.py are critical and will cause runtime errors. The missing dependencies will prevent users from running the example successfully. ### Confidence Score: 1/5 - This PR contains critical bugs that will cause runtime failures and prevent the chat example from working - Score reflects two critical logic errors (wrong variable reference in adapter.py:329 and inconsistent attribute access in character.py:70-73) plus missing dependencies that will cause import errors. These issues will break the example for users and cause AttributeErrors at runtime. - Pay close attention to plugins/plugin-inmemorydb/python/elizaos_plugin_inmemorydb/adapter.py (line 329 bug), packages/python/elizaos/bootstrap/providers/character.py (lines 70-73 inconsistency), and examples/chat/python/chat.py (missing python-dotenv dependency)

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | docs/python-quickstart.md | 3/5 | New documentation file added. Missing plugin-inmemorydb installation instruction that the chat example now requires. | | examples/chat/python/chat.py | 2/5 | Added dotenv and inmemorydb support. Missing python-dotenv dependency in requirements, which will cause import errors. | | packages/python/elizaos/bootstrap/providers/character.py | 2/5 | Fixed to use getattr for optional character attributes. Critical bug: return data dict directly accesses attributes without getattr, causing AttributeError. | | plugins/plugin-inmemorydb/python/elizaos_plugin_inmemorydb/adapter.py | 1/5 | Enhanced get_memories(), create_memory(), and update_memory() to handle Pydantic models. Critical bug in update_memory line 329: uses wrong variable name. |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant chat.py participant dotenv participant AgentRuntime participant OpenAIPlugin participant InMemoryDBPlugin participant InMemoryAdapter participant CharacterProvider User->>chat.py: Run python chat.py chat.py->>dotenv: load_dotenv(env_path) dotenv-->>chat.py: Load .env from repo root chat.py->>AgentRuntime: Create with character and plugins AgentRuntime->>OpenAIPlugin: Initialize OpenAI plugin AgentRuntime->>InMemoryDBPlugin: Initialize InMemoryDB plugin InMemoryDBPlugin->>InMemoryAdapter: create_database_adapter(agent_id) InMemoryAdapter-->>InMemoryDBPlugin: Return adapter instance InMemoryDBPlugin->>AgentRuntime: register_database_adapter(adapter) AgentRuntime->>CharacterProvider: get_character_context() CharacterProvider->>CharacterProvider: Use getattr() for optional attributes CharacterProvider-->>AgentRuntime: Return character context AgentRuntime-->>chat.py: Runtime initialized User->>chat.py: Type message chat.py->>AgentRuntime: handle_message(runtime, memory) AgentRuntime->>InMemoryAdapter: get_memories(params) InMemoryAdapter-->>AgentRuntime: Return memories AgentRuntime->>OpenAIPlugin: Generate response OpenAIPlugin-->>AgentRuntime: Return response AgentRuntime->>InMemoryAdapter: create_memory(memory_dict) InMemoryAdapter-->>AgentRuntime: Memory stored AgentRuntime-->>chat.py: Return result chat.py-->>User: Display response ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * In-memory database plugin for agent memory. * Token-by-token streaming for chat responses and streaming endpoints. * Atropos data-generation, trajectory tooling, and TextWorld agent integrations. * New Ticâ€‘Tacâ€‘Toe AI/player options and interactive configuration. * **Documentation** * Expanded developer setup, examples, runnable chat walkthroughs, and new Atropos CLI flags. * **Other** * Updated Python packaging/requirements and repository-root .env loading for examples. âœï¸ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

topPRs.title: V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (test if context is going to blown)
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
Redo #6113 for 2.0.0, first pass --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces a validation-aware, schema-driven prompt execution path and applies it across runtimes and message flows. > > - Adds `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state`/`dynamicPromptExecFromState` (TS/Python/Rust) with per-field/checkpoint UUID validation codes, required-field checks, and retry with backoff; supports XML/JSON > - Refactors message handling (should-respond, single-shot, multi-step decision, final summary) to use structured schemas instead of ad-hoc parsing > - Implements streaming support in TS with `ValidationStreamExtractor`, `MarkableExtractor`, and streaming context helpers; emits rich `StreamEvent`s > - Introduces shared types: `SchemaRow`, `RetryBackoffConfig`, `StreamEvent(Type)` in Python/Rust/TS type modules > - Adds XML parsing utilities (nested-safe) and normalizes structured responses; basic templating in Rust, Handlebars in TS > - Exposes validation level configuration (0â€“3) and model selection; defaults to large text models > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 1e447bbc005cbad715eb819aba27eb35b54aa5b8. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot). ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added dynamic prompt execution with state injection and schema-driven validation. * Enabled validation-aware streaming with configurable validation levels (0-3). * Introduced built-in retry logic with exponential backoff for improved resilience. * Support for structured output validation across JSON and XML formats. * Per-field and checkpoint-level validation for enhanced data integrity. âœï¸ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Summary

Introduces `dynamicPromptExecFromState()` across Python, Rust, and TypeScript runtimes to provide schema-driven prompt execution with context validation via UUID codes. The implementation detects when LLMs truncate output due to limited context windows by injecting validation codes at strategic positions (start/middle/end or per-field). Supports four validation levels (0=trusted to 3=full), exponential backoff retries, and optional validation-aware streaming via `ValidationStreamExtractor`. **Key changes:** - Cross-language API consistency for dynamic prompt execution with state injection - Validation code system to detect context overflow (4 levels: trusted, progressive, checkpoint, full) - Streaming integration with progressive validation and retry support - Schema-based structured output parsing (XML/JSON) with required field validation - Performance metrics tracking per model+schema combination (TypeScript only) - Comprehensive type definitions (`SchemaRow`, `RetryBackoffConfig`, `StreamEvent`) **Critical issues in Python implementation:** - Callable prompt invocation wraps state incorrectly (`{"state": state}` vs direct state access) - Template substitution assumes `state.values` has dynamic attributes accessible via `dir()`, incompatible with protobuf State - XML parsing regex `\w+` won't match validation field names with underscores like `code_text_start` **Minor issues:** - Rust template rendering uses basic string replacement instead of full Handlebars compiler - TypeScript `_smartRetryContext` deletion during retry loop prevents reuse on subsequent attempts - ValidationStreamExtractor abort handling may leave inconsistent state

Confidence Score: 3/5

- Python implementation has runtime errors that will break production usage; TypeScript and Rust implementations are safer but need testing - Score reflects critical logical errors in Python (3 bugs that will cause runtime failures), plus architecture differences across languages. TypeScript implementation is most complete with metrics and full Handlebars support. Python bugs must be fixed before merge to avoid breaking callers. - `packages/python/elizaos/runtime.py` requires immediate fixes for callable invocation, state.values access pattern, and XML regex. Test the Python implementation thoroughly before merging.

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/python/elizaos/runtime.py | Adds `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state` with validation codes and retry logic; has critical bugs in callable invocation, state.values access, and XML parsing regex | | packages/rust/src/runtime.rs | Implements `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state` with validation and retry; template rendering is basic string replacement vs full Handlebars | | packages/typescript/src/runtime.ts | Implements `dynamicPromptExecFromState` with metrics, streaming, and validation; minor issue with `_smartRetryContext` deletion timing | | packages/typescript/src/utils/streaming.ts | Implements validation-aware streaming with multiple extractor types; minor state inconsistency on abort signal |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client participant Runtime participant ValidationExtractor participant LLM participant Parser Client->>Runtime: dynamicPromptExecFromState(state, schema, options) Note over Runtime: Generate validation codes
(UUID snippets) Runtime->>Runtime: Build extended schema
with validation fields Runtime->>Runtime: Inject codes into prompt
(initial, middle, end) Runtime->>Runtime: Compile template with
Handlebars/state values alt Streaming enabled Runtime->>ValidationExtractor: Create extractor
(level, schema, codes) end loop Retry attempts (0 to maxRetries) Runtime->>LLM: Generate text with prompt alt Streaming loop Stream chunks LLM-->>ValidationExtractor: chunk ValidationExtractor->>ValidationExtractor: Extract field content ValidationExtractor->>ValidationExtractor: Check per-field codes
(level 0-1) ValidationExtractor-->>Client: Stream validated content end else Non-streaming LLM-->>Runtime: Complete response end Runtime->>Runtime: Clean response
(remove tags) Runtime->>Parser: Parse XML/JSON response Parser-->>Runtime: Parsed fields object Runtime->>Runtime: Normalize structured response alt Validation level 0-1 loop For each field with code Runtime->>Runtime: Check start/end codes match end else Validation level 2-3 Runtime->>Runtime: Check checkpoint codes
(one_initial, one_middle, etc) end Runtime->>Runtime: Validate required fields
are present and non-empty alt All validations pass alt Streaming (level 2-3) Runtime->>ValidationExtractor: flush() ValidationExtractor-->>Client: Buffered content end Runtime->>Runtime: Remove validation code fields Runtime->>Runtime: Update success metrics Runtime-->>Client: Return parsed response else Validation fails alt Has retries remaining Runtime->>Runtime: Calculate backoff delay Runtime->>Runtime: Wait for backoff Note over Runtime: Loop continues with retry else No retries left Runtime->>Runtime: Update failure metrics Runtime-->>Client: Return null end end end ```

topPRs.title: feat(v2.0.0): wasm agent runtime
topPRs.author: revlentless
topPRs.body:
# Summary Rust WASM implementation for elizaOS v2.0.0 - enabling the Rust core to run in browser/Node.js environments via WebAssembly. # Risks **Low risk.** This PR: - Makes no breaking API changes to existing Rust code - Uses conditional compilation (`#[cfg]`) so native builds are unaffected - All existing tests continue to pass - Adds new WASM-specific code paths that only activate when building for `wasm32-unknown-unknown` # Background ## What does this PR do? This PR makes the elizaOS Rust core **fully WASM-compatible**, enabling it to run in browsers and Node.js via WebAssembly. The existing Rust crate had WASM bindings but they were stubs - the `WasmAgentRuntime` was a placeholder that didn't actually wrap the real `AgentRuntime`. The key challenge was that Rust's `async_trait` and many traits require `Send + Sync` bounds for thread-safety, but WASM is single-threaded and doesn't support these traits. This PR implements platform-aware macros and conditional compilation to provide the correct bounds for each target. ### Key Changes #### 1. Platform-Aware Macros (`src/platform.rs`) ```rust // Native: #[async_trait] (requires Send) // WASM: #[async_trait(?Send)] (no Send requirement) platform_async_trait! { pub trait MyTrait { ... } } // Native: pub trait MyTrait: Send + Sync { ... } // WASM: pub trait MyTrait { ... } define_platform_trait! { pub trait MyTrait { ... } } ``` #### 2. Core Trait Migration All core traits now compile for both targets: - `ActionHandler`, `ProviderHandler`, `EvaluatorHandler` - `DatabaseAdapter`, `Service`, `IAgentRuntime` - Bootstrap traits: `Action`, `Provider`, `Evaluator`, `Service` #### 3. Real WasmAgentRuntime The `WasmAgentRuntime` now wraps the actual `AgentRuntime` using WASM-appropriate primitives: ```rust pub struct WasmAgentRuntime { inner: Rc>>, // Not Arc - WASM is single-threaded character: RefCell, agent_id: UUID, } ``` #### 4. Structured WASM Errors Rich error objects for JavaScript consumers: ```rust pub struct WasmError { pub code: String, // "VALIDATION_ERROR", "RUNTIME_ERROR", etc. pub message: String, // Human-readable message pub source: Option, // Field/component that caused error } ``` #### 5. JavaScript Shims Type-safe wrappers for JS callbacks: ```rust pub struct JsModelHandler { js_object: JsValue, handle_func: Function, } ``` #### 6. Bug Fix: ChannelType Serialization Fixed `ChannelType` enum to serialize correctly: - Before: `VoiceDm` â†’ `"VOICEDM"` âŒ - After: `VoiceDm` â†’ `"VOICE_DM"` âœ… ## What kind of change is this? - **Features** (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - **Bug fixes** (ChannelType serialization) - **Improvements** (structured errors, better WASM integration) # Documentation changes needed? My changes require a change to the project documentation: - Added `examples/README.md` with usage instructions for native and WASM examples - WASM module includes JSDoc comments for all exports # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? 1. `src/platform.rs` - Platform macros (foundation of the approach) 2. `src/types/components.rs` - Core handler traits with conditional compilation 3. `src/wasm/mod.rs` - WasmAgentRuntime implementation 4. `__tests__/wasm/` - TypeScript tests verifying WASM bindings ## Detailed testing steps ### Native Tests (Rust) ```bash cd packages/rust cargo test --features native # Expected: 79 tests pass ``` ### WASM Binding Tests (TypeScript/Vitest) ```bash cd packages/rust npx vitest run __tests__/wasm/wasm-bindings.test.ts # Expected: 16 tests pass ``` ### Full Test Suite ```bash cd packages/rust ./run-all-tests.sh # Expected: 108 passed, 0 failed, 2 skipped ``` ### Native Examples ```bash cargo run --example basic_runtime --features native cargo run --example with_handlers --features native ``` ### WASM Examples (Bun) ```bash bun run examples/wasm/basic.ts bun run examples/wasm/runtime.ts bun run examples/wasm/chat.ts # Interactive ``` ## Test Coverage | Suite | Tests | Status | |-------|-------|--------| | Rust native (`cargo test`) | 79 | âœ… | | WASM bindings (Vitest) | 16 | âœ… | | Interop equivalence (Vitest) | 16 | âœ… | | Python serialization | 22 | âœ… | | **Total** | **133** | âœ… | # Commits | Commit | Description | |--------|-------------| | `2ea503d` | feat(rust): improved WASM foundation with structured errors and JS shims | | `d00b690` | chore(rust): add wasm-test.sh for running WASM tests | | `e2b9ff7` | fix(rust): gate tokio tests for native-only, fix WASM test imports | | `f74293d` | feat(rust): add platform-aware macros for native/WASM compatibility | | `90c3e0e` | fix(rust): correct ChannelType serialization to match TypeScript | | `9c87349` | feat(rust): make core traits WASM-compatible | | `fbffb3d` | test(rust): expand WASM test coverage | | `9c3bc11` | test(rust): add WASM tests for platform macros | | `368f0aa` | test(rust): add WASM tests for core handler traits | | `17bfad1` | feat(rust): make all async_trait impls WASM-compatible | | `15c96d4` | feat(rust): upgrade WasmAgentRuntime to wrap real AgentRuntime | | `a4f717e` | test(rust): add comprehensive WASM integration tests | | `629d30a` | style: apply cargo fmt across all files | | `6a58014` | docs(rust): add native and WASM examples | | `85a4043` | fix(rust): fix WASM tests to match Rust type definitions | | `cbaea5a` | fix(rust): fix TypeScript type errors in WASM tests | # Files Changed ``` packages/rust/ â”œâ”€â”€ src/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ platform.rs # NEW: Platform macros â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ lib.rs # Export platform module â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ runtime.rs # Conditional Send+Sync on traits â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ types/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ components.rs # ActionHandler, ProviderHandler, EvaluatorHandler â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ service.rs # Service, TypedService traits â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ environment.rs # ChannelType serialization fix â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ bootstrap/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ runtime.rs # IAgentRuntime trait â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ actions/mod.rs # Action trait â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ providers/mod.rs # Provider trait â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ evaluators/mod.rs # Evaluator trait â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ services/mod.rs # Service trait â”‚ â””â”€â”€ wasm/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ mod.rs # WasmAgentRuntime (upgraded) â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ error.rs # NEW: WasmError struct â”‚ â””â”€â”€ shims/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ mod.rs # NEW: JS shim exports â”‚ â””â”€â”€ model_handler.rs # NEW: JsModelHandler â”œâ”€â”€ __tests__/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ wasm/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ wasm-bindings.test.ts # WASM binding tests â”‚ â””â”€â”€ interop-equivalence.test.ts # Serialization equivalence tests â”œâ”€â”€ examples/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ README.md # NEW: Examples documentation â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ basic_runtime.rs # NEW: Native example â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ with_handlers.rs # NEW: Native example â”‚ â””â”€â”€ wasm/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ basic.ts # NEW: WASM/Bun example â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ runtime.ts # NEW: WASM/Bun example â”‚ â””â”€â”€ chat.ts # NEW: Interactive chat example â”œâ”€â”€ Cargo.toml # Example entries â”œâ”€â”€ package.json # npm scripts for examples â”œâ”€â”€ run-all-tests.sh # Updated test runner â””â”€â”€ wasm-test.sh # NEW: WASM test script ``` # Architecture ``` â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ Conditional Compilation â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤ â”‚ #[cfg(not(target_arch = "wasm32"))] â”‚ #[cfg(wasm32)] â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤ â”‚ trait Foo: Send + Sync â”‚ trait Foo â”‚ â”‚ #[async_trait] â”‚ #[async_trait(?Send)]â”‚ â”‚ Arc â”‚ Rc> â”‚ â”‚ tokio runtime â”‚ wasm-bindgen-futuresâ”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â–¼ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ WasmAgentRuntime â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤ â”‚ inner: Rc>> â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Methods: â”‚ â”‚ - create(character_json) â†’ WasmAgentRuntime â”‚ â”‚ - initialize() â†’ Promise â”‚ â”‚ - handleMessage(msg_json) â†’ Promise â”‚ â”‚ - registerModelHandler(type, JsModelHandler) â”‚ â”‚ - stop() â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â–¼ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ JavaScript Usage â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤ â”‚ import { WasmAgentRuntime, JsModelHandler } from 'elizaos';â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ const runtime = WasmAgentRuntime.create(characterJson); â”‚ â”‚ await runtime.initialize(); â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ runtime.registerModelHandler('TEXT_LARGE', new JsModelHandler({â”‚ â”‚ handle: async (params) => { /* call LLM */ } â”‚ â”‚ })); â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ const response = await runtime.handleMessage(messageJson); â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ```

# Greptile Summary

- Implements comprehensive WASM compatibility for elizaOS Rust core, enabling the runtime to execute in browsers and Node.js environments via WebAssembly without breaking existing native functionality - Introduces platform-aware macros and conditional compilation patterns to handle Send+Sync trait differences between native (multi-threaded) and WASM (single-threaded) targets - Upgrades `WasmAgentRuntime` from a stub implementation to a fully functional wrapper around the real `AgentRuntime`, with structured error handling, JavaScript interop shims, and comprehensive test coverage # Important Files Changed | Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | `packages/rust/src/platform.rs` | New platform abstraction module providing macros for conditional async_trait bounds and Send+Sync requirements | | `packages/rust/src/wasm/mod.rs` | Upgraded WasmAgentRuntime implementation wrapping real AgentRuntime with WASM-compatible primitives and structured errors | | `packages/rust/src/types/components.rs` | Core handler traits migrated to use platform-aware conditional compilation for ActionHandler, ProviderHandler, and EvaluatorHandler | | `packages/rust/tests/wasm_tests.rs` | New comprehensive WASM test suite with 1506 lines validating cross-platform compatibility and JavaScript interoperability | | `packages/rust/src/types/environment.rs` | Fixed ChannelType serialization to use SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE format for TypeScript compatibility ("VOICE_DM" instead of "VOICEDM") | # Confidence score: 5/5 - This PR is extremely safe to merge with minimal risk of production issues - Score reflects excellent architectural approach using conditional compilation, comprehensive test coverage (133 tests passing), and non-breaking changes that preserve all native functionality while adding new WASM capabilities - All files demonstrate consistent application of platform-aware patterns with proper error handling and thorough documentation

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant WasmAgentRuntime participant JsModelHandler participant AgentRuntime participant Character participant State participant ModelHandler User->>WasmAgentRuntime: create(characterJson) WasmAgentRuntime->>Character: parse JSON Character-->>WasmAgentRuntime: Character instance WasmAgentRuntime-->>User: WasmAgentRuntime User->>WasmAgentRuntime: initialize() WasmAgentRuntime->>AgentRuntime: new(RuntimeOptions) AgentRuntime-->>WasmAgentRuntime: AgentRuntime instance WasmAgentRuntime-->>User: Promise User->>WasmAgentRuntime: registerModelHandler(type, handler) WasmAgentRuntime->>JsModelHandler: store handler JsModelHandler-->>WasmAgentRuntime: registered User->>WasmAgentRuntime: handleMessage(messageJson) WasmAgentRuntime->>Memory: parse message JSON Memory-->>WasmAgentRuntime: Memory instance WasmAgentRuntime->>AgentRuntime: compose_state(message) AgentRuntime->>State: build state State-->>AgentRuntime: State instance WasmAgentRuntime->>Character: get character data Character-->>WasmAgentRuntime: character info WasmAgentRuntime->>WasmAgentRuntime: build prompt WasmAgentRuntime->>JsModelHandler: call(params) JsModelHandler->>ModelHandler: handle(paramsJson) ModelHandler-->>JsModelHandler: responseJson JsModelHandler-->>WasmAgentRuntime: response text WasmAgentRuntime->>Memory: create response memory Memory-->>WasmAgentRuntime: response memory WasmAgentRuntime-->>User: Promise User->>WasmAgentRuntime: stop() WasmAgentRuntime->>JsModelHandler: clear handlers WasmAgentRuntime->>AgentRuntime: cleanup WasmAgentRuntime-->>User: stopped ```

Context used (3)

 - Context from `dashboard` - CLAUDE.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=8ef4c9a3-e221-4aef-8556-8c9b88bf6bbb)) - Context from `dashboard` - .cursorrules ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=00074882-001f-44b1-89c4-859ed3656db9)) - Context from `dashboard` - AGENTS.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=51febe90-8918-4f18-be1f-d43bb68d696c))

topPRs.title: feat: Framework for adjusting prompts to best fix model contexts
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
# Risks

Low, new feature, uses some memory but I put configurable limit on it

# Background

## What does this PR do?

It add a dynamic prompt execution system

## What kind of change is this?

Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?

People may use models with lower context and get hallucination, this helps detect when the context is blown out.

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes require a change to the project documentation.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Introduces a schema-based dynamic prompt executor with validation/retries/metrics and replaces ad-hoc prompting in message flows, plus supporting types/utils and test updates.
> 
> - **Core Runtime**:
>   - Add `runtime.dynamicPromptExecFromState(...)` for schema-driven prompt execution (XML/JSON parsing, UUID validation codes, retries, Handlebars state injection, token estimations).
>   - Track execution metrics via `modelSchemaMetrics` and `modelMetrics` with optional LRU eviction (`DYNAMIC_PROMPT_MAX_ENTRIES`) and retry policy (`VALIDATION_LEVEL`).
>   - Expose metrics getters/clearers; helper methods for cache/keys; minor logging adjustments.
> - **Message Service**:
>   - Replace manual `useModel` + XML parsing with `dynamicPromptExecFromState` in:
>     - `shouldRespond` evaluation (small model).
>     - Single-shot handler (requires `thought`, `actions`).
>     - Multi-step decision loop and final summary.
>   - Improve error logging and minor flow tweaks.
> - **Types/Utils**:
>   - Export `SchemaRow` and `State` from `types`; extend `IAgentRuntime` with `dynamicPromptExecFromState`.
>   - Export `upgradeDoubleToTriple` and `composeRandomUser` from `utils`.
> - **Tests/Test Utils**:
>   - Update `message-service` tests to mock `dynamicPromptExecFromState` responses.
>   - Add mock implementation in test runtime; minor logger formatting changes.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5905b5f9ab86dd7b7d727d92060575f42a8fc707. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: [Draft] RLM provider prototype for Eliza Python core
topPRs.author: matomoniwano
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

N/A (exploratory / draft integration)

# Risks

Low

- Provider is opt-in and not registered by default
- No existing code paths are modified unless the RLM provider is explicitly used
- Fallback stub behavior when RLM dependency is not installed

# Background

## What does this PR do?


This PR introduces a **prototype RLM provider** for the Eliza Python core.

It adds:
- A minimal `RLMProvider` that follows the existing provider interface
- A thin `RLMClient` adapter that wraps an external Recursive Language Model (RLM)
- Safe stub behavior when the RLM dependency is not present

The goal is to explore whether RLM can be integrated cleanly as a reasoning backend,
without affecting Elizaâ€™s memory, planning, or autonomy layers.

This is intentionally an early draft meant for discussion and iteration.

## What kind of change is this?

Features (non-breaking, opt-in)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?

Idea originated from this tweet https://x.com/shawmakesmagic/status/2013151880810057772?s=20

This PR is an experiment to see if RLM can fit naturally into the existing
provider/model boundary without increasing coupling or complexity.

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

- `elizaos/providers/rlm_provider.py`
- `elizaos/providers/rlm_client.py`
- `elizaos/providers/README.md`
- `python/tests/test_rlm_provider.py`

## Detailed testing steps

- Instantiate `RLMProvider`
- Call `generate_text` with a prompt or messages
- Verify stub behavior when RLM is not installed
- Verify successful pass-through when RLM is available locally

No automated tests are included at this stage.

# Deploy Notes

n/a

## Discord username
Discord: matomo8925
X: https://x.com/momo_mattomo
Prj X: https://x.com/AgentRLM
